headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: objective_type
parameters.description: Advertising objective. Only supports REACH , VIDEO_VIEWS , RF_REACH .

parameters.name: brand_safety_type
parameters.description: Brand safety type. Default value: STANDARD_INVENTORY . Enum values: EXPANDED_INVENTORY : Use TikTok's brand safety solution. Expanded inventory means that your ads will appear next to content where most inappropriate content has been removed, and may contain some mature themes. In the next API version, EXPANDED_INVENTORY will replace NO_BRAND_SAFETY and will be the default brand safety option. STANDARD_INVENTORY : Use TikTok's brand safety solution. Standard inventory means that ads will appear next to content that is appropriate for most brands. LIMITED_INVENTORY : Use TikTok's brand safety solution. Limited inventory means that your ads will not appear next to content that contains mature themes. Note : Pre-bid first-party Brand Safety solutions for APP_PROMOTION , WEB_CONVERSIONS , TRAFFIC , LEAD_GENERATION objectives in Auction ads, and pre-bid third-party brand safety solutions are currently allowlist-only features. If you would like to access them, please contact your TikTok representative. See Brand safety to learn about the supported advertising objectives for pre-bid Brand Safety filtering.

parameters.name: rf_campaign_type
parameters.description: Note : When objective_type is specified as RF_REACH , use this field to set the campaign as a TikTok Pulse campaign, then you can get available premium contextual tags. Do not pass in this field when objective_type is not specified as RF_REACH . Enum values: STANDARD (Reach & Frequency campaign), PULSE （TikTok Pulse campaign）.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: contextual_tag_list
fields.description: Contextual tag list. Note : Contextual targeting is currently an allowlist-only feature. The returned value will be empty( [] ) if you don't apply for the allowlisting.

fields.name: contextual_tag_id
fields.description: Contextual tag ID. Note : Currently contextual tags can only be used together with audience targeting settings that target the following countries: General tags: US (the United States), CA (Canada), GB (the United Kingdom), DE (Germany), FR (France), IT (Italy) , ES (Spain), JP (Japan), KR (South Korea), AU (Australia)， BR (Brazil), MX (Mexico). Premium tags: US (the United States), CA (Canada), GB (the United Kingdom), DE (Germany), FR (France), IT (Italy) , ES (Spain), JP (Japan), KR (South Korea), AU (Australia)， BR (Brazil), MX (Mexico).

fields.name: type
fields.description: Contextual tag category. Enum values: GENERAL (general category), PREMIUM (premium category).

fields.name: content_lineup_type
fields.description: Content lineup types. Enum values: MAX_PULSE (Max Pulse: Your ads will show next to top content from any topics on TikTok.) CUSTOM (Category Lineups: Your ads will show next to top content from the categories or seasonal events you select.) Note : Currently, you can run Max Pulse targeting US (the United States), CA (Canada), BR (Brazil) and Category Lineups targeting US (the United States), CA (Canada), BR (Brazil), AU (Australia), GB (the United Kingdom), FR (France), IT (Italy), ES (Spain), DE (Germany). Both features are allowlist only. If you want to use them in the above markets, please contact your TikTok representative.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Contextual tag status. Enum: ONLINE , OFFLINE . Only ONLINE tags can be used to create ads.

fields.name: objective_types
fields.description: The advertising objectives that the contextual tag supports.

fields.name: region_codes
fields.description: The country or region codes that the contextual tag supports.
